trustfund:
TF034264-INDONESIA - TOURIST INFORMATION
            SYSTEM COMPONENT,TF034698-INDONESIA - INFORM.INFRAST.
            & APPLI. DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF034699-INDONESIA - INFORM. INFRA. AND
            APPLIC. DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF034700-INDONESIA - INFORM. INFRA.&
            APPLICATION DEV. PROJECT,TF036405-EAST ASIA - DEVELOPING EAST
            ASIA'S INFORMATION INFRASTRUCTURE

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Information Infrastructure Development Project (IIDP) for
            Indonesia is to enhance private sector participation in
            providing information technology (IT), postal, and tourism
            services by removing barriers to entry. There are five
            components. The The first involves improving the legal and
            regulatory framework by providing advisory services,
            training, and equipment to prepare laws and regulations on
            intellectual property rights; carries out policy studies,
            trains staff, and strengthens the policy or institutional
            capacities of the state secretariat; improves the copyright,
            patent, and trademark directorate, as well as the national
            development planning agency. The second component enhances
            the efficiency and effectiveness of researchers by expanding
            the science and technology network. The third component,
            having two sub-components, strengthens the legal and
            regulatory framework to promote private sector participation
            in postal services; and extends tourist information services
            to the regions by developing the business model and pilot
            projects for an electronic tourism information system. The
            fourth and fifth components provide technical assistance and
            training to promote private participation and IT service
            delivery, and project management assistance, respectively.
